resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
tianchen92 commented on pull request #6044: ARROW-7405: [Java] ListVector isEmpty API is incorrect
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6044
 
 
   Related to [ARROW-7405](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7405).
   
   Currently isEmpty API is always return false in BaseRepeatedValueVector, and its subclass ListVector did not overwrite this method.
   This will lead to incorrect result, for example, a ListVector with data [1,2], null, [], [5,6] should get [false, false, true, false] with this API, but now it would return [false, false, false, false].
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

   > Related to [ARROW-7405](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7405).
   > 
   > Currently isEmpty API is always return false in BaseRepeatedValueVector, and its subclass ListVector did not overwrite this method.
   > This will lead to incorrect result, for example, a ListVector with data [1,2], null, [], [5,6] should get [false, false, true, false] with this API, but now it would return [false, false, false, false].
   
   For [1,2], null, [], [5,6], it should return [false, true, true, false]? 
   as in most scenarios, null should be considered empty?

emkornfield commented on pull request #6044: ARROW-7405: [Java] ListVector isEmpty API is incorrect
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6044#discussion_r365117055
 
 

 ##########
 File path: java/vector/src/main/java/org/apache/arrow/vector/complex/ListVector.java
 ##########
 @@ -710,14 +710,29 @@ public Object getObject(int index) {
   /**
    * Check if element at given index is null.
    *
-   * @param index  position of element
+   * @param index position of element
    * @return true if element at given index is null, false otherwise
    */
   @Override
   public boolean isNull(int index) {
     return (isSet(index) == 0);
   }
 
+  /**
+   * Check if element at given index is empty list.
+   * @param index position of element
+   * @return true if element at given index is empty list, false otherwise
+   */
+  public boolean isEmpty(int index) {
 
 Review comment:
   @Override I'm surpised Error prone didn't can this.

emkornfield commented on issue #6044: ARROW-7405: [Java] ListVector isEmpty API is incorrect
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6044#issuecomment-572927097
 
 
   >For [1,2], null, [], [5,6], it should return [false, true, true, false]?
   as in most scenarios, null should be considered empty?
   
   It might be worth a quick e-mail to the mailing list to see if anybody is used it at the expected behavior.  Given that is has been broken for this long, I'm not sure it makes too much of a difference. Either way we should be clarified in the parent class at least.
   
   I'm not entirely sure the two should be conflated (we might want to throw an exception instead of returning a boolean) but I would need to think about this some more.

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
Currently {{isEmpty}} API is always return false in {{BaseRepeatedValueVector}}, and its subclass {{ListVector}} did not overwrite this method.

This will lead to incorrect result, for example, a {{ListVector}} with data [1,2], null, [], [5,6] should get [false, false, true, false] with this API, but now it would return [false, false, false, false].
